EventItemActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: Oversight - Rebuilding After Sandy and Improving the Resiliency of the City’s Infrastructure.
EventItemMatterName: Oversight - Rebuilding After Sandy and Improving the Resiliency of the City’s Infrastructure.

EventItemTitle: Jointly with the Committee on Housing and Buildings the Committee on Environmental Protection the Committee on Parks and Recreation and the Committee on Transportation

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, the New York city mechanical code and the New York city fire code, in relation to relocating and protecting building systems in flood-prone areas.
EventItemMatterName: Relocating and protecting building systems in flood-prone areas.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, the New York city building code and the New York city mechanical code, in relation to cabling for certain building systems and fuel-oil storage in flood-prone areas.
EventItemMatterName: Cabling for certain building systems and fuel-oil storage in flood-prone areas.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to removing barriers to the usage of temporary flood control and response devices.
EventItemMatterName: Removing barriers to the usage of temporary flood control and response devices.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring backup power sources for fire and life safety communications systems.
EventItemMatterName: Requiring backup power sources for fire and life safety communications systems.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to improving hazardous materials storage pursuant to the New York city community right-to-know law.
EventItemMatterName: Improving hazardous materials storage pursuant to the NYC community right-to-know law.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the New York city plumbing code and the New York city building code, in relation to preventing the backflow of sewage.
EventItemMatterName: Preventing the backflow of sewage.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a manual on flood construction and protection standards.
EventItemMatterName: Creating a manual on flood construction and protection standards.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code and the New York city mechanical code, in relation to preventing wind damage to certain buildings and systems.
EventItemMatterName: Preventing wind damage to certain buildings and systems.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to studying the effects of wind on certain buildings.
EventItemMatterName: Studying the effects of wind on certain buildings.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to using cool roof surfaces to reduce summer heat.
EventItemMatterName: Using cool roof surfaces to reduce summer heat.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, the New York city building code, and the New York city mechanical code, in relation to emergency and standby power systems and natural gas usage.
EventItemMatterName: Emergency and standby power systems and natural gas usage.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to secondary electrical power, heating and cooling systems for I-1 and I-2 occupancies and for adult homes, enriched housing, community residences and intermediate care facilities, where such occupancies are located in flood-prone areas.
EventItemMatterName: Secondary electrical power, heating and cooling systems for I-1 and I-2 occupancies and for adult homes, enriched housing, community residences and intermediate care facilities, where such occupancies are located in flood-prone areas.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to keeping residential stairwells and hallways lit during blackouts.
EventItemMatterName: Keeping residential stairwells and hallways lit during blackouts.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the New York city plumbing code and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring residential buildings to provide drinking water to a common area supplied directly through pressure in the public water main.
EventItemMatterName: Requiring residential buildings to provide drinking water to a common area supplied directly through pressure in the public water main.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the New York city plumbing code, in relation to requiring that toilets and faucets be capable of operating without an external supply of electrical power.
EventItemMatterName: Requiring that toilets and faucets be capable of operating without an external supply of electrical power.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to emergency preparedness recommendations for owners of residential and commercial buildings and the posting of emergency information in certain residential buildings.
EventItemMatterName: Emergency preparedness recommendations for owners of residential and commercial buildings and the posting of emergency information in certain residential buildings.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a study on permeable roadway and sidewalk materials.
EventItemMatterName: Study on permeable roadway and sidewalk materials.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to flood-resistant construction requirements for health facilities.
EventItemMatterName: Flood-resistant construction requirements for health facilities.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to the adoption of best available flood maps.
EventItemMatterName: Adoption of best available flood maps.

EventItemActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to enact and the President to sign the Flood Victim Premium Relief Act of 2013.
EventItemMatterName: Flood Victim Premium Relief Act of 2013.

EventItemActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.3942/A.4380, the “Engineers’, Architects’, Landscape Architects’ and Land Surveyors’ Good Samaritan Act” which would protect from liability professional engineers, architects, landscape architects and land surveyors who render voluntary services at the scene of a natural disaster or catastrophe.
EventItemMatterName: Engineers’, Architects’, Landscape Architects’ and Land Surveyors’ Good Samaritan Act (S.3942/A.4380)

EventItemActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to amend the Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012.
EventItemMatterName: Biggert-Waters Flood Insurance Reform Act of 2012.

EventItemActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to planning for resiliency to climate change as a responsibility of the office of long-term planning and sustainability.
EventItemMatterName: Planning for resiliency to climate change as a responsibility of the office of long-term planning and sustainability.

EventItemTitle: Roll Call

EventItemActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee
EventItemTitle: Oversight - Rebuilding After Sandy and Improving the Resiliency of the City’s Infrastructure.
EventItemMatterName: Oversight - Rebuilding After Sandy and Improving the Resiliency of the City’s Infrastructure.
